biography_text: GUTIÉRREZ, Luis V., a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., December 10, 1953; B.A., Northeastern Illinois University, DeKalb, Ill., 1974; teacher; social worker, Illinois state department of children and family services; administrative assistant, Chicago, Ill., mayor’s office subcommittee on infrastructure, 1984-1985; co-founder, West Town-26th Ward Independent Political Organization, 1985; alderman, Chicago, Ill., city council, 1986-1993, president pro tem, 1989-1992; delegate, Democratic National Committee, 1984; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-present).
